Posts.Content: Jun 28, 2008 02:06PM sushi2 wrote: vhqh, Did you have a scar from the procedure like with a lumpectomy? My radiologist would not be doing the procedure, the surgeon would.
Posts.Title: surgical biopsy with needle localization sushi2 sahalie

Posts.Content: sushi2 wrote: Has anyone not been able to eat soy while on chemotherapy?  My oncologist said to avoid eating soy.  How long does this have to last for?  Soy is in just about EVERYTHING.  I'm hoping I'll be able to eat some after my chemotherapy. Dx 1/3/2008, DCIS, 1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 2, 2/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Soy sushi2 lvtwoqlt

Posts.Content: sushi2 wrote: Has anyone every had a surgical biopsy with needle localization? I just had a mammography and the radiologist suggested going to my surgeon and have this done.  I just had a lumpectomy this past February and I'm presently going through chemotherapy. I hate to have another surgery again. Dx 1/3/2008, DCIS, 1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 2, 2/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: surgical biopsy with needle localization sushi2 sahalie

Posts.Content: sushi2 wrote: I just had a lumpectomy (IDC) in February 2008 and I'm presently undergoing chemotherapy.  I noticed some spots on my nipple, so the oncologist suggested an ultrasound. Ultra sound of the nipple area showed nothing.  The radiologist wanted to do some more mammo pictures and now wants me to go through a surgical biopsy with my surgeon.  Has anyone ever gone through this while on chemotherapy?  I thought the radiologist would do the biopsy.  This seems like an awful lot since I haven't even had my radiation yet. Dx 1/3/2008, DCIS, 1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 2, 2/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Another biopsy after lumpectomy sushi2 sushi2

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2008 07:54PM sushi2 wrote: I completed 4 rounds of AC and now I'm onto TH.  I still don't need a port.  My  oncologist didn't even suggest it.  Although, I guess it depends how good your veins are to begin with.  I agree if you have a capable nurse to begin with that helps.  I usually just ask for a hot pack to start out with.  Remember to stay hydrated as that helps the veins pop up and the tourniquet needs to be tight.
Posts.Title: Has anyone completed A/C tx successfully WITHOUT a port? deecsw MissUniverse
